briefdescription.para: The full set of allowed chars.

detaileddescription.para: Utilities for converting data from/to strings. Used by SanitizeString()
Used by ParseByteUnits() Lowercase base 1000 Uppercase base 1024

Remove unsafe chars. Safe chars chosen to allow simple messages/URLs/email addresses, but avoid anything even possibly remotely dangerous like & or >
str
The string to sanitize
rule
The set of safe chars to choose (default: least restrictive)
A new string without unsafe chars
Parse the hex string into bytes (uint8_t or std::byte). Ignores whitespace. Returns nullopt on invalid input.
Like TryParseHex, but returns an empty vector on invalid input.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::span< const unsigned char > input, bool pad=true)
memberdef.name: EncodeBase32

detaileddescription.para: Base32 encode. If pad is true, then the output will be padded with '=' so that its length is a multiple of 8.
Base32 encode. If pad is true, then the output will be padded with '=' so that its length is a multiple of 8.
Splits socket address string into host string and port value. Validates port value.

parameterdescription.para: The socket address string to split.
Port-portion of the input, if found and parsable.
Host-portion of the input, if found.

simplesect.para: true if port-portion is absent or within its allowed range, otherwise false

detaileddescription.para:
Tests if the given character is a decimal digit.
c
character to test
true if the argument is a decimal digit; otherwise false.
Tests if the given character is a whitespace character. The whitespace characters are: space, form-feed ('\f'), newline (' '), carriage return ('\r'), horizontal tab ('\t'), and vertical tab ('\v').
This function is locale independent. Under the C locale this function gives the same result as std::isspace.

simplesect.para: true if the argument is a whitespace character; otherwise false

detaileddescription.para: Convert string to integral type T. Leading whitespace, a leading +, or any trailing character fail the parsing. The required format expressed as regex is -?[0-9]+. The minus sign is only permitted for signed integer types.

simplesect.para: std::nullopt if the entire string could not be parsed, or if the parsed value is not in the range representable by the type T.

detaileddescription.para: Format a paragraph of text to a fixed width, adding spaces for indentation to any added line.
Timing-attack-resistant comparison. Takes time proportional to length of first argument.

Parse number as fixed point according to JSON number syntax.
true on success, false on error.
The result must be in the range (-10^18,10^18), otherwise an overflow error will trigger.

memberdef.argsstring: (O outfn, It it, It end, I infn={})
memberdef.name: ConvertBits

detaileddescription.para: Convert from one power-of-2 number base to another.

Converts the given character to its lowercase equivalent. This function is locale independent. It only converts uppercase characters in the standard 7-bit ASCII range. This is a feature, not a limitation.

parameterdescription.para: the character to convert to lowercase.

simplesect.para: the lowercase equivalent of c; or the argument if no conversion is possible.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the lowercase equivalent of the given string. This function is locale independent. It only converts uppercase characters in the standard 7-bit ASCII range. This is a feature, not a limitation.

parameterdescription.para: the string to convert to lowercase.

detaileddescription.para: Converts the given character to its uppercase equivalent. This function is locale independent. It only converts lowercase characters in the standard 7-bit ASCII range. This is a feature, not a limitation.

parameterdescription.para: the character to convert to uppercase.

simplesect.para: the uppercase equivalent of c; or the argument if no conversion is possible.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the uppercase equivalent of the given string. This function is locale independent. It only converts lowercase characters in the standard 7-bit ASCII range. This is a feature, not a limitation.

parameterdescription.para: the string to convert to uppercase.

detaileddescription.para: Capitalizes the first character of the given string. This function is locale independent. It only converts lowercase characters in the standard 7-bit ASCII range. This is a feature, not a limitation.

simplesect.para: string with the first letter capitalized.

detaileddescription.para: Parse a string with suffix unit [k|K|m|M|g|G|t|T]. Must be a whole integer, fractions not allowed (0.5t), no whitespace or +- Lowercase units are 1000 base. Uppercase units are 1024 base. Examples: 2m,27M,19g,41T

parameterdescription.para: the string to convert into bytes
if no unit is found in str use this unit

simplesect.para: optional uint64_t bytes from str or nullopt if ToIntegral is false, str is empty, trailing whitespace or overflow
